God of WisdomAnswered on 04 Oct 2018Hi Anon, the purpose of life insurance is to protect and replace the income that was supposed to be generated from the insured person.‚ÄãThe rules of thumb advised by LIA is to get:‚ÄãDeath & Permanent Disability Cover of 10 -15 X Your Annual IncomeCritical Illness Cover of 3 -5 X Your Annual Income‚ÄãThus, if any of the above scenarios were to happen, your family can continue life as is, without sacrificing on their quality of life. Kids still get to go to school and there's less pressure on the spouse to make up for that loss of income.‚ÄãIn the event of Critical Illness like Cancer, Stroke, Heart Attack, the insured will still be around, but he/she would need to stop work to recover. Usually you'll be able to get back on your feet in 3 - 5 years. While your hospitalization plan should pay for all your bills, that CI payout is to make sure you can focus on recovering quickly.‚ÄãAnd you can choose to protect these for a term or for the whole of your life. My clients usually do some term, some whole life. Coverage is important, but cashflow is important as well, so do strike a balance on your % of income that pays for insurance.0 comments2
